text: The rising of a liquid in an open and ended glass tube of narrow bore is
explanation: Capillarity, or capillary action, occurs when a liquid rises in a narrow space due to the adhesive forces between the liquid and the surface of the tube and the cohesive forces within the liquid itself.

text: Which of the following units is equivalent to the watt?
explanation:
\(Power = \frac{\text{Work done}}{time}\)
= \(\frac{Force \times distance}{time}\)
= \(\frac{mass \times acceleration \times distance}{time}\)
= \(\frac{kg \times m \times m}{s^{2} \times s}\)
= \(kgm^{2} s^{-3}\)

text: Which of the following statements about pressure in a liquid is correct?

options.A: the pressure in a liquid increases with depth
options.B: the higher the density of a liquid, the lower the pressure it exerts
options.C: pressure in liquid act only in a direction perpendicular to the sides of the containing vessel
options.D: pressure is independent of the acceleration due to gravity

explanation: At different depths, the pressure of a liquid differs.

text: Solid friction, like viscosity is

options.A: independent of the surface area in contact
options.B: independent of the relative motion between layers

explanation: The force acting on a body due to the viscous resistance of the surrounding fluid is called the drag force and it acts in the direction opposite to the direction of motion. So also does friction.

text: The slope of a linear distance-times graph represents
A body of mass 2kg is released from rest on a plane inclined at an angle of 60° to the horizontal. Calculate the acceleration of the body down the plane.[g = 10ms\(^{-2}\)]
The total area under a force-velocity graph represents
explanation:
Power = Force x Velocity.
Therefore, the area under the force- velocity graph gives Power.

text: A body of mass 20g projected vertically upwards in vacuum returns to the point of projection after 1.2s. [g = 10ms\(^{-2}\)]. Calculate the speed of projection
explanation:
To find the speed of projection, we can use the formula for the time of flight of an object projected vertically upwards:
\(t = \frac{2u}{g}\)
where:- \( t \) is the total time of flight (1.2 s),- \( u \) is the initial speed of projection,- \( g \) is the acceleration due to gravity (10 m/s²).
Rearranging the formula to solve for \( u \):
\(u = \frac{gt}{2}\)
Substituting the values:
\(u = \frac{10 \, \text{m/s}^2 \times 1.2 \, \text{s}}{2} = \frac{12}{2} = 6 \, \text{m/s}\)
Thus, the speed of projection is \( 6 \, \text{m/s} \).

From Newton's first law of motion,

options.A: a body can only undergo translational motion
options.B: once a body remains at rest no force acts on it
options.C: the net force acting in uniform linear motion is zero
options.D: a body's inertia is its weight

explanation: The key point of this law is that if there is no net force resulting from unbalanced forces acting on an object. If all the external forces cancel each other out, then the object will maintain a constant velocity.

options.A: increases with increase in the angle of inclination
options.B: increases with decrease in the angle of inclination
options.C: decreases with decrease in the angle of inclination
options.D: is independent of the angle of inclination

explanation: In general, the V.R and hence the M. A increases when the inclination angle decreases.

When salt is dissolved in water, the freezing point of the water
explanation: The salt in the water (same for any other impurities) lowers the freezing point of the solution so that water freezes at a lower temperature.

text: The equation of a certain progressive transverse wave is y = 2 sin 2 \(\pi ( \frac{t}{0.01} - \frac{x}{30})\), where x and y are in cm and t in seconds. Calculate the period of the wave.
explanation:
Compare: Y = 2 sin 2 \(\pi (\frac{t}{0.01} - \frac{x}{30})\)
with the wave equation,y = A sin 2 \(\pi (\frac{t}{T} - \frac{x}{\lambda}\))⇒ \(\frac{t}{T} = \frac{t}{0.01}\)T = 0.010s

text: Images formed by a convex mirror are always
explanation: Convex mirrors always form virtual images, which appear behind the mirror.

text: The refractive index of a material is 1.5. Calculate the critical angle at the glass-air interface
A diverging lens of focal length 30cm produces an image 20cm from the lens. Determine the object distance
explanation:
Lens formula:
\(\frac{1}{f} = \frac{1}{d_o} + \frac{1}{d_i}\)
where f, d\(_o\) and d\(_i\) are the focal length, object distance and image distance respectively.
The distance from the lens to the focal point is called the focal length. For converging lenses, the focal length is always positive, while diverging lenses always have negative focal lengths.
⇒ \(\frac{-1}{30} = \frac{1}{d_o} + \frac{1}{20}\)
\(\frac{1}{d_o} = \frac{-1}{30} - \frac{1}{20}\)
\(\frac{1}{d_o} = \frac{-2 + -3}{60}\)
→ \frac{-5}{60}\) = \frac{-1}{12}\)
\(d_o = - 12 cm\)
The object distance -12cm = 12cm on the other side of the lens.

text: Which of the following radiations has it's frequency lower than that of infrared radiation?
explanation: Radio waves have lower frequencies compared to infrared radiation, while ultraviolet rays, gamma rays, and x-rays have higher frequencies.

text: A string under tension produces a note of frequency 14Hz. Determine the frequency when the tension is quadrupled.
explanation:
The formula for the frequency in a stringed instrument : \(f = \frac{1}{2} \sqrt{\frac{T}{m}}\)
f = frequency; T = tension in the string; m = mass per unit lenth of the string.
f\(_1\) = 14 = \(\frac{1}{2} \sqrt{\frac{T}{m}}\).
When T is quadrupled, we have
f\(_2\) = new frequency = \(\frac{1}{2} \sqrt{\frac{4T}{m}}\)
= 2(\(\frac{1}{2} \sqrt{\frac{T}{m}}\))
= 2 f\(_1\)
= 2 x 14
= 28 Hz

C is inversely proportional to d.
